News.Title: Anmol India Board Meet Set for Feb 12 for Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: Anmol India Limited has scheduled its board meeting for February 12, 2026, to consider and approve unaudited standalone financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: Anmol India Appoints New Independent Director
News.Summary: Anmol India Ltd held an Extra-Ordinary General Meeting on December 26, 2025, to appoint Mr. Ripan Kumar Goyal as Non-Executive Independent Director through special resolution.

News.Title: Anmol India Non-Executive Director Passes Away
News.Summary: Anmol India Limited announces the sad demise of Non-Executive Director Mr. Kapil on December 18, 2025. He had served on the board since October 1, 2024.

News.Title: Anmol India Limited Appoints Ripan Kumar Goyal as Non-Executive Independent Director
News.Summary: Anmol India Limited has appointed Mr. Ripan Kumar Goyal (DIN: 11397550) as Non-executive Independent Director, subject to shareholder approval through Extra-Ordinary General Meeting. The appointment brings 29 years of banking experience from Union Bank of India and insurance advisory expertise to the company's board.

News.Title: Anmol India Reports ₹5.85 Crore Profit for Half-Year Ended September 2025
News.Summary: Anmol India Limited's Board approved unaudited financial results showing a profit of ₹5.85 crore for the half-year ended September 30, 2025, compared to ₹5.01 crore in the same period last year. The coal trading company reported revenue from operations of ₹805.65 crore for the half-year period, with earnings per share of ₹1.03.

News.Title: Anmol India Independent Director Bhupinderpreet Kaur to Resign Due to Personal Commitments
News.Summary: Anmol India announced that Independent Director Mrs. Bhupinderpreet Kaur will resign from her position effective September 30, 2025. She cited personal commitments as the reason for her resignation.

News.Title: Anmol India Limited Reports Quarterly Net Profit of ₹5.72 Crores
News.Summary: Anmol India Limited's Board of Directors approved unaudited standalone financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported revenue from operations of ₹577.36 crores compared to ₹520.93 crores in the same quarter last year. Net profit increased to ₹5.72 crores from ₹4.00 crores in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Earnings per share stood at ₹1.01 for both basic and diluted calculations. The company operates in coal trading and other items as a single business segment. The results were reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved at a Board meeting held on August 8, 2025.
